[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Event Emission Failure] Can an attacker trigger failpoints in event emission to prevent critical events (deposits, withdrawals) from being logged, breaking off-chain indexing and causing accounting mismatches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Module Loading Attack] Can an attacker use failpoints in Move module loader to cause malformed or malicious modules to be loaded, bypassing bytecode verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [API Denial of Service] Can an attacker configure failpoints in critical API endpoints (submit_transaction, get_account) to make the REST API completely unresponsive, preventing transaction submission? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Mempool Corruption] Can an attacker trigger failpoints in mempool validation to allow invalid transactions into the pool, wasting validator resources or causing crashes during execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [P2P Network Disruption] Can an attacker configure failpoints in network layer to disconnect all peers, isolate validators, or corrupt consensus messages in transit? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Indexer Corruption] Can an attacker use failpoints to corrupt internal indexer state, causing get_account and get_transactions APIs to return wrong data while storage is correct? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Health Check Bypass] Can an attacker trigger failpoints in health check endpoints to make unhealthy validators appear healthy, preventing load balancers from removing them from rotation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Metrics Manipulation] Can an attacker configure failpoints in metrics collection to hide attack evidence, manipulate performance metrics, or cause monitoring systems to generate false alerts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [TLS/HTTPS Bypass] Can an attacker use failpoints in TLS handling to downgrade connections to HTTP, expose secrets in transit, or bypass certificate validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Secret Leakage] The info! log at line 30-33 logs failpoint names and actions - can an attacker use failpoints to trigger error paths that log private keys, validator addresses, or internal state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Log Flooding] Can an attacker repeatedly configure failpoints to generate excessive logs, filling disk space and causing node crashes when logs rotate? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Error Message Disclosure] When fail::cfg() returns an error, can an attacker craft inputs that trigger verbose error messages revealing file paths, memory addresses, or implementation details? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Timing Side Channel] Can an attacker measure response times of failpoint configuration to infer internal state, validator configuration, or detect presence of other active failpoints? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Audit Log Bypass] If security events are logged, can an attacker configure failpoints to disable audit logging, hide their malicious activity, or corrupt log files? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [TOCTOU in Config Check] Between checking context.failpoints_enabled() at line 27 and calling fail::cfg() at line 28, can a concurrent thread/signal handler modify the config, bypassing the security check? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Concurrent Modification] Can multiple threads call set_failpoint_poem() concurrently, causing race conditions in fail::cfg() that corrupt failpoint state or cause use-after-free? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Atomic Configuration] If multiple failpoints need to be configured atomically (e.g., disable A and enable B together), can an attacker exploit the non-atomic nature to trigger failpoints in inconsistent states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Signal Handler Race] Can an attacker send signals (SIGTERM, SIGHUP) during failpoint configuration to interrupt fail::cfg() mid-operation, leaving failpoints in a partially-configured state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Context Sharing] The Arc<Context> is shared across threads - can an attacker exploit non-atomic reads of failpoints_enabled to bypass the check through torn reads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Accidental Mainnet Exposure] Can a misconfigured mainnet validator accidentally expose this endpoint due to wrong firewall rules, allowing attackers to halt mainnet consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Container Escape] In containerized deployments, can an attacker escape the container by triggering failpoints in low-level I/O operations, then exploiting resulting kernel panics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Persistent Failpoints] Are failpoints persistent across node restarts? Can an attacker configure failpoints that survive crashes, causing validators to fail repeatedly during recovery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Upgrade Attack] During node version upgrades, can an attacker configure failpoints in upgrade logic to corrupt the new binary, force rollback, or brick the node? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Cloud Metadata Service] In cloud environments, can an attacker use failpoints to corrupt requests to metadata services, stealing cloud credentials or escalating to cloud admin? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/set_failpoints.rs] [Function: set_failpoint_poem()] [Multi-Node Coordination] Can an attacker configure synchronized failpoints across multiple validators to trigger at the same consensus round, amplifying impact beyond single-node attacks? (High)
